meanings.definition: An instance that contradicts or disproves a general statement or rule.
meanings.sent1: In the debate, she presented a counterinstance that showed the theory was incorrect.
meanings.sent2: The scientist found a counterinstance that proved the hypothesis wrong.
meanings.sent3: The counterinstance she shared made everyone rethink their assumptions.
meanings.sent4: His discovery was a counterinstance that shattered the established belief.
meanings.sent5: The counterinstance stood out as a clear contradiction to the common belief.

meanings.definition: To provide an example that goes against a previously stated argument or theory.
meanings.sent1: He decided to counterinstance the theory by offering a different perspective.
meanings.sent2: She always counterinstances any argument that lacks evidence.
meanings.sent3: The professor counterinstanced the outdated theory with new research.
meanings.sent4: They counterinstanced the old idea with a fresh approach.
meanings.sent5: To counterinstance effectively, one must present solid evidence.
